intro: Guichenotia impudica, commonly known as the slender guichenotia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, often in sandy or gravelly soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, usually yellow or pale green flowers. Guichenotia impudica is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient environments.
